author: blair
msg: Coding style consistency fix: move the function's return type onto a

author: gstein
msg: Bring the branch up to date with respect to /trunk.
An extra change snuck into this commit:
Updated some comments on string/array lifetimes, and moved an array into
an iteration pool (though its values are longer-lived).
(generic_walker): dirkeys can be in the iteration pool. the string
values that we place into it are longer lived, however, matching the
requirements of the append_entries() helper function.

author: gstein
msg: Add a mode to the open() function for SQLite databases. The default of
auto-create is not going to work for us, so switch to the open_v2()
interface for better control when opening a database.
(svn_sqlite__mode_t): new enum specifying how to open a database
(svn_sqlite__open): add new mode paramter, switch to open_v2()
(SQLITE_ERR_MSG): new error wrapper that takes an explicit message
rather than fetching one from a database connection.
(init_sqlite): add some placeholder code for initializing the SQLite

author: danielsh

author: gstein
msg: Based on dev@ conversation, I realized that a given DB handle must already
be able to deal with multiple datastores (e.g. somebody moved a WC into
another one, and we discovered during a walk).
Even if we say "don't allow that", it will be easier on clients of wc_db.h
to no worry about which handle to use for any given target. We can resolve
(svn_wc__db_open_many): return a single db handle, rather than a hash of
